===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|宀|豕|c1=s|c2=p|t1=roof|t2=pig|ls=psc|no_och2=y}}.

{{lang|zh|豕}} is an abbreviation of {{och-l|豭|male pig, boar}} (''{{w|Shuowen Jiezi}}''), a homophone of {{zh-l|家}} in {{w|Old Chinese}}. See {{zh-l|*豭}} for more on the glyph composition.

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|いえ|yomi=k}}
/ihe<small>1</small>/: [ipe] → [iɸe] → [iwe] → [ie]. Possibly related to {{m|ja|廬|tr=io||temporary hut}}.

{{ja-pron|yomi=k|いえ|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

{{ja-pos|か|suffix}}
# (as suffix) an [[expert]], [[professional]], [[performer]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|うち|yomi=k}}
Cognate with {{m|ja|内|tr=uchi}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|うち|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|うち}}

# a house
# one's house

=====Descendants=====
* English: {{l|en|hooch}}

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|け|suffix}}

# a suffix representing relationship to a family
#: {{ja-usex|平'''家'''|たいら-'''け'''|the Taira family}}

===Etymology 3===
A contraction of [[家|uchi]] → chi. Often following the genitive case marker [[の|no]] which contracts to ''n''.

====Noun====

#: {{ja-usex|俺ん'''家'''に来ない？|おれ ん '''ち''' に こない？|Wanna come to my place?}}
